activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Tampering w/ a Global Positioning System Tracking Device

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Levi Skyler Mattila

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.
THE CASH BAIL OF $500 IN THIS CASE IS ALSO TO COVER 21CT100, 21CT124, 22CT41

1:08 PM Defendant Levi Skyler Mattila appeared by video in custody. Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Rockow appears in court for defendant for today.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 21CT100, 21CT124, 22CT41 AND 22CF249

1:13  Defendant and Atty. Rockow go into break-out room; 1;18 return from break-out room.

21CT100, 21CT124, 22CT41:  State moves to quash warrants; court grants motion. State moves to amend bonds to $500 cash bond to cover all three of these cases.  Court orders $500 bond to cover all four of the above cases with same conditions as previously ordered.

22CF249:  Bond set at $500 cash.  $500 covers all 4 of the above cases.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Bond, Amended Bonds, and MS scanned to jail)
